question_text: Which two factors are most likely to affect video output quality or compatibility over USB-C? (Select two)
answer_options: Whether the device supports MHL or DisplayPort alt mode
Whether the USB-C port has shielding against ESD
Whether the port supports USB 3.1 Gen 1 data transfer
Whether the cable length exceeds 3 meters
correct_answer: Whether the device supports MHL or DisplayPort alt mode
explanation: Video over USB-C depends on alternate mode support (like DisplayPort or MHL) and bandwidth capacity â€” especially at higher resolutions. Some cables lack the requirements for Thunderbolt or full video signaling.
